trans-unit.source: P/Invokes should not be visible
trans-unit.target: P/Invokes should not be visible

trans-unit.source: A public or protected method in a public type has the System.Runtime.InteropServices.DllImportAttribute attribute (also implemented by the Declare keyword in Visual Basic). Such methods should not be exposed.
trans-unit.target: A public or protected method in a public type has the System.Runtime.InteropServices.DllImportAttribute attribute (also implemented by the Declare keyword in Visual Basic). Such methods should not be exposed.

trans-unit.source: P/Invoke method '{0}' should not be visible
trans-unit.target: P/Invoke method '{0}' should not be visible

trans-unit.source: PInvoke declarations should be portable
trans-unit.target: PInvoke declarations should be portable

trans-unit.source: This rule evaluates the size of each parameter and the return value of a P/Invoke, and verifies that the size of the parameter is correct when marshaled to unmanaged code on 32-bit and 64-bit operating systems.
trans-unit.target: This rule evaluates the size of each parameter and the return value of a P/Invoke, and verifies that the size of the parameter is correct when marshaled to unmanaged code on 32-bit and 64-bit operating systems.

trans-unit.source: As it is declared in your code, parameter {0} of P/Invoke {1} will be {2} bytes wide on {3} platforms. This is not correct, as the actual native declaration of this API indicates it should be {4} bytes wide on {3} platforms. Consult the MSDN Platform SDK documentation for help determining what data type should be used instead of {5}.
trans-unit.target: As it is declared in your code, parameter {0} of P/Invoke {1} will be {2} bytes wide on {3} platforms. This is not correct, as the actual native declaration of this API indicates it should be {4} bytes wide on {3} platforms. Consult the MSDN Platform SDK documentation for help determining what data type should be used instead of {5}.

trans-unit.source: As it is declared in your code, the return type of P/Invoke {0} will be {1} bytes wide on {2} platforms. This is not correct, as the actual native declaration of this API indicates it should be {3} bytes wide on {2} platforms. Consult the MSDN Platform SDK documentation for help determining what data type should be used instead of {4}.
trans-unit.target: As it is declared in your code, the return type of P/Invoke {0} will be {1} bytes wide on {2} platforms. This is not correct, as the actual native declaration of this API indicates it should be {3} bytes wide on {2} platforms. Consult the MSDN Platform SDK documentation for help determining what data type should be used instead of {4}.

trans-unit.source: Specify marshaling for P/Invoke string arguments
trans-unit.target: Specify marshaling for P/Invoke string arguments

trans-unit.source: A platform invoke member allows partially trusted callers, has a string parameter, and does not explicitly marshal the string. This can cause a potential security vulnerability.
trans-unit.target: A platform invoke member allows partially trusted callers, has a string parameter, and does not explicitly marshal the string. This can cause a potential security vulnerability.

trans-unit.source: To reduce security risk, marshal parameter {0} as Unicode, by setting DllImport.CharSet to CharSet.Unicode, or by explicitly marshaling the parameter as UnmanagedType.LPWStr. If you need to marshal this string as ANSI or system-dependent, set BestFitMapping=false; for added security, also set ThrowOnUnmappableChar=true.
trans-unit.target: To reduce security risk, marshal parameter {0} as Unicode, by setting DllImport.CharSet to CharSet.Unicode, or by explicitly marshaling the parameter as UnmanagedType.LPWStr. If you need to marshal this string as ANSI or system-dependent, set BestFitMapping=false; for added security, also set ThrowOnUnmappableChar=true.

trans-unit.source: To reduce security risk, marshal field {0} as Unicode, by setting StructLayout.CharSet on {1} to CharSet.Unicode, or by explicitly marshaling the field as UnmanagedType.LPWStr. If you need to marshal this string as ANSI or system-dependent, use the BestFitMapping attribute to turn best-fit mapping off, and for added security, ensure ThrowOnUnmappableChar is on.
trans-unit.target: To reduce security risk, marshal field {0} as Unicode, by setting StructLayout.CharSet on {1} to CharSet.Unicode, or by explicitly marshaling the field as UnmanagedType.LPWStr. If you need to marshal this string as ANSI or system-dependent, use the BestFitMapping attribute to turn best-fit mapping off, and for added security, ensure ThrowOnUnmappableChar is on.

trans-unit.source: To reduce security risk, marshal parameter {0} as Unicode, by setting DllImport.CharSet to CharSet.Unicode, or by explicitly marshaling the parameter as UnmanagedType.LPWStr. If you need to marshal this string as ANSI or system-dependent, specify MarshalAs explicitly, and set BestFitMapping=false; for added security, also set ThrowOnUnmappableChar=true.
trans-unit.target: To reduce security risk, marshal parameter {0} as Unicode, by setting DllImport.CharSet to CharSet.Unicode, or by explicitly marshaling the parameter as UnmanagedType.LPWStr. If you need to marshal this string as ANSI or system-dependent, specify MarshalAs explicitly, and set BestFitMapping=false; for added security, also set ThrowOnUnmappableChar=true.

trans-unit.source: To reduce security risk, marshal field {0} as Unicode, by setting StructLayout.CharSet on {1} to CharSet.Unicode, or by explicitly marshaling the field as UnmanagedType.LPWStr. If you need to marshal this string as ANSI or system-dependent, specify MarshalAs explicitly, use the BestFitMapping attribute to turn best-fit mapping off, and for added security, to turn ThrowOnUnmappableChar on.
trans-unit.target: To reduce security risk, marshal field {0} as Unicode, by setting StructLayout.CharSet on {1} to CharSet.Unicode, or by explicitly marshaling the field as UnmanagedType.LPWStr. If you need to marshal this string as ANSI or system-dependent, specify MarshalAs explicitly, use the BestFitMapping attribute to turn best-fit mapping off, and for added security, to turn ThrowOnUnmappableChar on.

trans-unit.source: Use managed equivalents of win32 api
trans-unit.target: Use managed equivalents of win32 api

trans-unit.source: An operating system invoke method is defined and a method that has the equivalent functionality is located in the .NET Framework class library.
trans-unit.target: An operating system invoke method is defined and a method that has the equivalent functionality is located in the .NET Framework class library.

trans-unit.source: Use managed equivalents of win32 api
trans-unit.target: Use managed equivalents of win32 api

trans-unit.source: Always consume the value returned by methods marked with PreserveSigAttribute
trans-unit.target: Always consume the value returned by methods marked with PreserveSigAttribute

trans-unit.source: PreserveSigAttribute indicates that a method will return an HRESULT, rather than throwing an exception. Therefore, it is important to consume the HRESULT returned by the method, so that errors can be detected. Generally, this is done by calling Marshal.ThrowExceptionForHR.
trans-unit.target: PreserveSigAttribute indicates that a method will return an HRESULT, rather than throwing an exception. Therefore, it is important to consume the HRESULT returned by the method, so that errors can be detected. Generally, this is done by calling Marshal.ThrowExceptionForHR.

trans-unit.source: Consume the hresult returned by method '{0}' and call Marshal.ThrowExceptionForHR.
trans-unit.target: Consume the hresult returned by method '{0}' and call Marshal.ThrowExceptionForHR.

trans-unit.target: Globalization

trans-unit.target: Interoperability

trans-unit.target: Portability

trans-unit.target: Reliability

trans-unit.source: Usage
trans-unit.target: Usage

trans-unit.source: Mark boolean PInvoke arguments with MarshalAs
trans-unit.target: Mark boolean PInvoke arguments with MarshalAs

trans-unit.source: The Boolean data type has multiple representations in unmanaged code.
trans-unit.target: The Boolean data type has multiple representations in unmanaged code.

trans-unit.source: Add the MarshalAsAttribute to parameter {0} of P/Invoke {1}. If the corresponding unmanaged parameter is a 4-byte Win32 'BOOL', use [MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.Bool)]. For a 1-byte C++ 'bool', use MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.U1).
trans-unit.target: Add the MarshalAsAttribute to parameter {0} of P/Invoke {1}. If the corresponding unmanaged parameter is a 4-byte Win32 'BOOL', use [MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.Bool)]. For a 1-byte C++ 'bool', use MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.U1).

trans-unit.source: Add the MarshalAsAttribute to the return type of P/Invoke {0}. If the corresponding unmanaged return type is a 4-byte Win32 'BOOL', use MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.Bool). For a 1-byte C++ 'bool', use MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.U1).
trans-unit.target: Add the MarshalAsAttribute to the return type of P/Invoke {0}. If the corresponding unmanaged return type is a 4-byte Win32 'BOOL', use MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.Bool). For a 1-byte C++ 'bool', use MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.U1).
